title: Register or log in to student finance

details.description: Log in to your student finance account or sign up for a new one - see when your payments are due,  track your application, change your details and apply for new finance
details.more_information:
Only full-time students can apply online.

%Applications for courses starting from 1 September 2013 will open in January 2013.%

Part-time students must apply by post. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download 'Tuition Fee Loan application form for new part-time students (PDF, 1.1MB)](http://www.sfengland.slc.co.uk/media/377625/sfe_ptl1_form_1213.pdf "Download Tuition Fee Loan form for new part-time students (PDF, 1.1MB)")
$D

^If you've forgotten your log in, [reset your password and find your details.](https://secure.studentfinance.direct.gov.uk/portal/page?_pageid=379,1732148&_dad=portal&_schema=PORTAL "Reset your password and find your details"){:rel="external"}^

$C
**Student Finance England**  
**Telephone:** 0845 300 50 90  
**Minicom:** 0845 604 44 34  
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm  
Saturday and Sunday, 9am to 5:30pm
$C

##Change your details
Full-time students can change their details (eg address, bank details) through their online account.

You must contact Student Finance England by phone if:

- your household income changes 
- your name changes
- your marital status changes
- your parents have more children
- you're a part-time student

For changes to your Tuition Fee Loan or your course contact your university or college.
details.introduction: Log in to your student finance account or sign up. Once registered, you can apply for student finance, see when payments are due, track your application and change your details.

details.description: Including loans, bursaries, grants, student finance and paying back loans
Get help if you're at school, planning to go on to further or higher education, looking for training or interested in a student or career development loan.
Use this student finance calculator to estimate what student finance you could get for university - student loans, student grants, bursaries and other funding
